fr.irit.smac.amak

Interface Schedulable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Amas, AntHillExample, AsyncAntsAMASExample, AsyncTest.MyAMAS, AsyncTest.MyEnvironment, AsyncWorldExample, CommandLineOnlyResolution.MyAMAS, CommandLineOnlyResolution.MyEnv, DrawableUI, Environment, Order.MyAMAS, Order.MyEnv, PhilosophersAMASExample, ScalibilityTest.MyAMAS, ScalibilityTest.MyEnvironment, TableExample, ThreadTest.AgentPhaseDrawer, ThreadTest.MyAMAS, ThreadTest.MyEnvironment, WorldExample

    public interface Schedulable
    A schedulable object can be controlled by a scheduler
    Author:
    Alexandre Perles

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_SLEEP
      The default time between scheduler cycle

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cycle()
      A cycle of the schedulable system
      void onSchedulingStarts()
      This method is called when the scheduler starts
      void onSchedulingStops()
      This method is called when the scheduler stops (by stopCondition or explicit stop)
      boolean stopCondition()
      Check if the schedulable must be stopped by the scheduler.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_SLEEP

        static final int DEFAULT_SLEEP
        The default time between scheduler cycle
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • cycle

        void cycle()
        A cycle of the schedulable system

      • stopCondition

        boolean stopCondition()
        Check if the schedulable must be stopped by the scheduler. For example, a stop condition can be "cycle==5000" aiming at stopping the system at the cycle 5000 in order to extract results or simply debugging.
        Returns:
        if the scheduler must stops its execution

      • onSchedulingStarts

        void onSchedulingStarts()
        This method is called when the scheduler starts

      • onSchedulingStops

        void onSchedulingStops()
        This method is called when the scheduler stops (by stopCondition or explicit stop)
